name: Campaignion
description: Campaignion is a web application I built using JavaScript to standardize and expedite the workflow documentation process in Adobe Campaign Standard. The tool uses a variation of Breadth First Search to parse HTML from the Developer Console and number the activities in the workflow accordingly. It also outputs description tables corresponding to the activities (which can be broken down for larger workflows) and provides an option to export the generated documentation to Word.
tools: JavaScript, React Spectrum, Adobe I/O Runtime, HTML/CSS

name: Adobe's Playful Palette
description: For my senior project in Spring 2019, I re-implemented Adobe's Playful Palette, an interactive parametric color mixer for digital artists, in WebGL and JavaScript. Users can blend color gamuts to create gradients and retrieve past mixing dishes to easily recolor strokes in the artwork. To implement the color blending, I used a variant of the metaball function.

name: The New York Times
description: As a Graphics Intern on the Immersive Storytelling team, I prototyped 3-D assets to visualize AR moments, researched and tested emerging technologies like the Microsoft Hololens, and contributed graphics in the articles below. I also worked on the intern-led 3-D Crossword game built using Three.js, where I set up the camera and worked on UI functionality.
tools: JavaScript, HTML/CSS, Three.js, Maya, Photoshop, Illustrator, After Effects, Sketchfab

description: As an Interactive Web Developer for The Daily Pennsylvanian, I created the newspaperâ€™s first online game written entirely in vanilla JavaScript.
